data.value: If there is more than one such value, only one is returned. The bin-count for the modal bins is also returned.
The mode of object arrays is calculated using
, which treats NaNs with different binary representations as distinct.
Support for non-numeric arrays has been deprecated as of SciPy 1.9.0 and will be removed in 1.11.0.
The mode of arrays with other dtypes is calculated using
. In NumPy versions 1.21 and after, all NaNs - even those with different binary representations - are treated as equivalent and counted as separate instances of the same value.
n-dimensional array of which to find mode(s).
Axis along which to operate. Default is 0. If None, compute over the whole array
Defines how to handle when input contains nan. The following options are available (default is 'propagate'):
'propagate': treats nan as it would treat any other value
'omit': performs the calculations ignoring nan values
